reviews.sentence: Grand stay. great location. Stayed for three days in late January and were impressed with the friendly staff wonderful accommodations nice pool and hot tub and great location for touring the SD area. Highly recommended.
Affordable lodging in La Jola. Although an older property this location affords a good value in La Jola. Pool and Jacuzi are excellent. Staff very pleasant and knowledgeable. Updates are done well.
sweet. Customer service excellent. Room comfortable. Pool and spa very clean and refreshing Breakfast. All was great.

A nostalgic gem. We loved the nostalgic feel of this Travelodge. Our room was clean and comfortable. The shower large and roomy. The staff was very helpful from Olga at the front desk to the maintenance man who wiped down the chairs and tables by the pool. And the beach is only a couple blocks away. We are excited to visit and stay here again.

Exceptional. Loved this locationeasy walk to beach and the hot tub and pool were very nicethe employees were all so helpful with directions and friendlythe su casa so close has great food and the little lunch and breakfast place ca nt remember name but was good and manderine house was good as weli went with a girl friend i hadbt seen in a long time to have some girl funenjoyed it so much i m going back in 5 weeks.

Nice to stay. Location is excellent right on the beach that is plus. In our room is suite yes we happy to have microwave and toaster also plus. Price is great including a small breakfast. swim pool is nice and clean. A staff he cleaning pool very morning. Staff is excellent. They r great we r happy stay here for 6 this so comfortable to stay again. This is not super fancy hotel. But nice and clean and happy place.

Just a Lovely Place. I had the loveliest for a staycation at the Travelodge La Jola Beach. Everyone there from Will Olga and Tricia at the front desk to Florencia in housekeeping was so welcoming and professional. The rooms are very well appointed the parking is free and so is the wifi. There is coffee fruit and water at all times in the lobby and danish and bagels are added for breakfast. The jacuzi is lovely and the property is very near the beach. I will definitely return.

Great family fun. The hotel staff were fantastic. They are kind happy and certainly kid friendly. Check in and out was simple. The location was close to the beach. We watched the surfers and the waves at the beach down the street. It is a short drive to Mission beach and Sea World. The hotel is also close to the Childrens pool area where the seals and pups are. The continental breakfast was great. Coffee was great. The room was a nice size with a refrigerator microwave and toaster. The only thing I do not recommend is walking around the neighborhood to the La Jola Cove. it is farther than you think and I got the impression that the locals really do not like strangers walking through their neighborhoods. Other than that I would recommend the hotel and will stay here again. There is a washer and dryer located at the pool. Pool and Jacuzi were fun for kids and I.

I love the Travelodge on La Jola Blvd. I love EVERYTHING about the Travelodge the friendly efficient staff from the manager to the housekeepers maintenance personnel and gardeners. When i stay there I stay for 2 weeks to a month so I really get to know everyone. I like the continental breakfast the pool the jacuzi but the lovely wonderful people who work there. It is a family and I will never stay anyplace else when I go to San Diego.

Comfortable motel but a long way from centre of town. Comfortable bed good free wifi nice pool good laundry facilities. Noisy through the wall air conditioner made sleeping difficult. Long way from centre of La Jola about 2 km and no good local restaurants. No breakfast seating area.

We had a newly updated room very nice. The facility is currently undergoing renovations but it did not impact our stay other than the pool area was closed for a few of our days. A short walk to the beach with gorgeous sunsets.

Good. Staff were friendly. New renovated room was nice but nowhere to hang towels. Hotel was undergoing renovations so a lot of things were closed like the pool area ice machine and breakfast room. Noise from upstairs room of person walking was quite loud.

Nightmare check before you book. The rooms have been refitted and will be nice once the snagging is complete eg no hooks in bathroom dust from building works outside. The hotel is very near the beach and restaurants so great location and will be good when it is finished. Staff on front desk were very helpful but i felt I was conned into booking this hotel and paying the rate that I paid. A major refurbishment was underway when we arrived and we were allocated a room right beside the works. There was excessive noise until 630 in the evening and then from 8 in the morning and lots of dust. Builders were walking past our room all day. The hotel and bokingcom websites do not flag this up and I alerted them over a week ago so suggest you check before you book. The hotel description says it is a boutique hotel with all year round pool which was a reason we booked it but the pool was set up as the builders yard. Breakfast was served in the reception which was a converted bedroom and it was chaotic and very disappointing.

Great value for money in the San Diego area. Clean and modern basic hotel room old refurbished motel. Beds are very comfortable. And the balcony is nice to have. Very nice and helpful staff. Let us use the showers by the pool after having checked out that day. Good location in La Jola. No decent door between bed and bathroom the rooms are a little dark with just on front window.

Great staff. The staff is very friendly. They really try to make things right for you and to help. They smile all the time. It puts you in a good mood. The property has been doing amazing renovations. They could redo the pool area as well. That would be great. An earlier check in time would be nice too.
Close to the beach and walking to La Jola shops. Motel style but very large rooms and small pool available.

It was okay. The soaps and lotions smelled nice towels were clean and fluffy. The whole place was nice and clean. it is also very close to a couple breakfast spots and restaurants. The bathroom door is one of those big sliding things and it does not lock and it does not close tight. so everyone else in the room can hear you do your business pretty clearly. You could also hear everything outside of the room pretty loudly. Whether it was just people walking by or the staff moving things around or the people cleaning the room with those huge carts you could hear it all. They also had free parking but it was a couple of small lots and there is nt enough spots for everyone. Thankfully we found some street parking close by. I was also looking forward to a little pool time but I did nt think the pool looked great. Maybe they need to re tile it or give it a new paint job or something. I passed.
Love be there small place to eat next door. Great food. Small hotel quiet. Bathroom need towel rack and hooks to hang towels and swim wear. The pool needs some help.

Wonderful. The Shoal is situated very near the beach which is an added bonus and close to getting downtown or the Torey Pine Cliffs. The place itself is oddly situated but so are many homes in La Jola. We were always able to find parking onsite but not necessarily in front of our room. We enjoyed swimming in the pool as the weather was quite hot in Sept However the pool area is small and not very appealing but the water is clean. The coffee was great but I thought there had be a continental breakfast. You could make oatmeal if you wanted though. There was not closet in the room but the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was clean. Compared to other places priced really high The Shoal suited us for the three nights just fine.

A Great CA Beach Getaway. What a great location. We walked everywhere along the beach to shopping and to lunch and dinner. The decor in the room was amazing love the teal doors and the black white theme in the bathroom and the comfy bed was like sleeping on a cloud. We did not want to leave and come home to our own bed. Since we only stayed one night we did not have time to enjoy the pool area but it looked clean and very inviting. As many other travelers have mentioned in their reviews the staff here is over the top friendly and helpful which is just the icing on the cake. Tricia checked us in and out and we absolutely loved her sparkling personality. The young gentleman my husband interacted with at the front desk in the evening was great as well. we will definitely stay here again if we are in the area and we highly recommend The Shoal Hotel La Jola BeachWe were pleased with everything.
